text.section:
Except as provided in subsection (a) of this section or otherwise in this title, each clerk shall account for and distribute the fees received for licenses issued under this title as follows:
the clerk shall pay into the General Fund of the State:
the percentage of license fees authorized by law as a fee of the office;
the additional issuance fee now allowed; and
3% of license fees to defray the expenses of the State License Bureau; and
except as provided in subsection (c) of this section, the clerk shall distribute the remaining license fees:
to the municipal corporation where the licensed business or activity is located, if the licensed business or activity is located in a municipal corporation; or
to the county where the licensed business or activity is located, if the licensed business or activity is not located in a municipal corporation.

section.section:
For purposes of this subsection, per capita revenue shall be computed by using the population figures from the later of:
the most recent federal census; or
an official local census.

The clerk may not distribute license fees to a county or municipal corporation unless the county or municipal corporation:
levies, in its current fiscal year, taxes sufficient to collect at least $1.00 per capita in revenue; and
certifies to the Comptroller a copy of the levy.

The clerk shall pay into the General Fund of the State any money that is not distributed at the end of the fiscal year of a county or municipal corporation because the county or municipal corporation failed to make the levy and certification required by paragraph (2) of this subsection.
